Legal_Issue: Is the trademark 'Deli Snack' registrable under the Trade-marks Act?
Evidence_Assessment: Average consumer's perception, context of use of the mark 'Deli Snack'
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant (Neptune S.A.) to demonstrate registrability
Legal_Rule: A trademark is not registrable if it is clearly descriptive or deceptively misdescriptive of the character or quality of the associated goods
Procedural_Issue: Review of Registrar's decision by Federal Court
Grounds_for_Claim: Attempt to register 'Deli Snack' as a trademark for seafood products
Outcome_on_Merits: Appeal dismissed; trademark found clearly descriptive
Key_Evidence_Considered: Meaning and consumer perception of 'Deli Snack'
Applicant_Challenge: Registration of 'Deli Snack' opposed due to descriptiveness
Defendant_Response: Registrar rejected application on grounds of descriptiveness
Evidence_Type: Descriptive nature of the term in relation to goods
Applicable_Process: Administrative review followed by judicial appeal
Governing_Rule: Trade-marks Act, s. 12(1)(b): Prohibition on registering clearly descriptive marks
